meanings.definition: The position or authority of a master.
meanings.sent1: In the land of make-believe, the teddy bear ruled with masterdom over all the other toys.
meanings.sent2: The king's masterdom was unquestioned by his loyal subjects.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed masterdom over the house, demanding treats and belly rubs.
meanings.sent4: The masterdom of the CEO extended to every corner of the company, shaping its culture and direction.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's masterdom of magic was evident in the way he effortlessly cast spells.

meanings.definition: The state of being a master.
meanings.sent1: Her masterdom in chess was evident as she defeated opponent after opponent.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterdom of painting techniques was admired by all who saw her work.
meanings.sent3: The dog achieved masterdom in obedience training, impressing its owner with every command obeyed.
meanings.sent4: His masterdom of the guitar was so complete that he could make it sing like no other.
meanings.sent5: The chef's masterdom of flavors created dishes that left diners speechless with delight.

meanings.definition: The domain or realm over which a master has control.
meanings.sent1: The pirate captain's masterdom included the entire stretch of the open sea.
meanings.sent2: The wizard's masterdom extended to the enchanted forest where he practiced his magic.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel claimed masterdom over the backyard, chasing away any intruding birds.
meanings.sent4: The queen's masterdom over the kingdom was challenged by a neighboring ruler.
meanings.sent5: The master's masterdom of the dojo was evident in the discipline and skill of his students.
